thread.title: Millburn High School girls tennis player Schrage reaches singles final
thread.title_full: Millburn High School girls tennis player Schrage reaches singles final

title: Millburn High School girls tennis player Schrage reaches singles final
text:
Millburn High School girls tennis player Schrage reaches singles final October 15, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 15, 2015, 10:37 AM By Jim Connelly Buy this photo staff photo by jim connelly Millburn High School's Stephanie Schrage, shown here hitting a return Oct. 8 in the state sectional team tournament semifinals, will compete in the state singles title match Saturday, Oct. 17, against Vineland High School's Tess Fisher at Mercer County Park in West Windsor. 
Jennifer Tuchband is the only player in the history of the Millburn High School girls tennis program to have won a New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association singles championship. 
Junior Stephanie Schrage hopes to become the second. 
Schrage, the top seed, is scheduled to oppose second-seeded Tess Fisher of Vineland High School in the state final Saturday, Oct. 17, at Mercer County Park in West Windsor. The match is set for 10 a.m. 
Both players advanced to the title match by posting wins in the quarterfinals and semifinals Oct. 11 at Mercer County Park. 
Schrage, the 2014 state singles runner-up, dispatched Andrea Carden of Paramus Catholic High School 6-4, 6-4 in the quarterfinals and Ashley Hess of the Academy of Holy Angels 6-0, 6-0 in the semifinals. 
"Going into the quarterfinals, I knew I had a challenge ahead of me," Schrage said. 
"I faced my friend Andrea Cerdan, one of the top players in the country and one of the best players in the tournament, in an earlier round than I expected. The quarterfinal was a great match, we both played and competed really well. 
"My win in the quarterfinals gave me lots of momentum, which boosted me in the semifinals." 
Fisher reached the semifinals with a 6-1, 6-3 defeat of Shore Regional High School's Halah Davis. Claudia Siniakowicz of West Windsor-Plainsboro South High School fell to Fisher in the semifinals 1-6, 6-1, 6-0. 
"In last year's final I faced a great player (top-seeded Katy Fahey of Rumson-Fair Haven Regional High School) and unfortunately lost a close and hard fought battle in three sets," Schrage said. 
Schrage, the fourth seed in the 2014 singles tournament, fell to Fahey 6-2, 3-6, 6-1. 
"I have never played this year's finals opponent before, but I am eager to return to the finals and grab this opportunity." 
MILLER NOTES 
Tuchband claimed the 1998 state singles crown with a win over Newark Academy's Nina Kamp. 
Zenia Matkiwsky (1979), Rachel Cantor (2007) and Schrage are the school's state singles runners-up. 
Email: connellyj@northjersey.com
